definition: Russia/Russian/abbr. for 俄羅斯|俄罗斯[E2 luo2 si1]/Taiwan pr. [E4]

sentences.english: It will play an ac- five role in studying the Russian teaching.
sentences.chinese: 對於俄語教學的研究有着積極的作用。

sentences.english: She used to study Russian, but lately she changed to biology.
sentences.chinese: 她原來是學俄語的，但最近改學了生物。

sentences.english: In fact, speakers of Russian would say that submarines do swim.
sentences.chinese: 事實上俄語的使用者確實會說“潛艇能遊”。

sentences.english: Russian language lesson for deaf children.
So he began to learn Russian.
Russian and Lithuanian are also widely spoken.
She speaks Russian fluently and yet she prefers to chatter in English.
sentences.chinese: 她說俄語很流利，可是她更喜歡用英語交談。

sentences.english: "M1 power" from a foreign language school, the end to test Russian.
sentences.chinese: “m1冪”來自某校外語專業，期末要考俄語。

sentences.english: Russian is far mole difficult than Spanish.
sentences.chinese: 俄語比西班牙語難學多了。

sentences.english: But I'm still living in the Russian-language media space.
sentences.chinese: 但我仍然生活在俄語媒體範圍內。

sentences.english: I don't call Russian a hard language.
sentences.chinese: 我不認爲俄語是門難學的語言。

sentences.english: The individual republics have often made their native language co-official next to Russian.
sentences.chinese: 各自的共和國通常也將俄語和本土母語作爲官方語言。

sentences.english: They are students of the Russian department.
He says this in his last Russian novel, The Gift.
sentences.chinese: 他在最後一本其俄語小說《禮物》中這麼說。

definition: Korean language (esp. in context of South Korea)
variant of 詞彙|词汇[ci2 hui4]
hangul, Korean phonetic alphabet/Korean written language
